intro: Collinsia divaricata, commonly known as the slender checkerbloom, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Collinsia divaricata is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to well-drained soils.
